Enjoying what life and the world has to offer and looking for those 3-4 things that can done from home base or while traveling to keep the mind strong and help fund world adventures.
Director IT Operations. International Growth. Business Architecture and Quality Assurance Testing.

As Director of IT Operations, one of my roles is to define and configure international business requirements for future expansion. Work closely with business units to identify cultural uniqueness and also to comply with local laws and regulations. Successfully roll-out to new markets with as little to no impact on existing business. Assisting the business with ideas and developing and maintaining business capabilities in line with the corporate technology strategy. Managing the strategy and growth of an IT QA team, integrating into an Agile SCRUM development methodology.

Managing the Business Analysis team and responsible for defining and building a Quality Testing team. This included but not limited to, defining business requirements, application support, testing of all new enhancements and break fixes and ensuring that the E-Commerce platform was as functional and stable as possible.

Origami Owl makes meaningful, personalized jewelry that captures a piece of your heart. But, they’re about more than just jewelry—they’re about people! Everyone is so friendly, fun and helpful in the best kind of way.Strive to be a force for good and make a difference in the lives of others and love, inspire + motivate people of all ages to reach their dreams. Origami Owl Custom Jewelry is a social selling company & was founded by a 14 year old entrepreneur Bella! www.origamiowl.com/story. Part of the International team learning the business and helping define the future of O2.

summary: Experienced IT Director across many industries and technologies. In this role I currently lead the company’s Business Analysis, Q.A. Testing, Help Desk functions and International expansion. Having started my career in development and made my way through the ranks, with a knack for interpreting business language into technical solutions. Managing large teams or managers in various roles, which includes building teams from scratch and coaching them to a higher level.Managed solutions and resources across multiple technologies such as Mainframe, Client Server, Data Warehousing, Business Intelligence, Infrastructure and E-Commerce.Contract experience in Hardware, Software, 3rd Party Resourcing and Licensing negotiations with vendors such as IBM and Microsoft.Before joining Origami Owl, I was lucky enough to work with amazing global companies such as TJX, National Bank of Australia, Tesco and British Aerospace.I’m truly passionate about my work. While I enjoy all aspects of my job, I think my favorite stage of any project is working with the client or business unit leader to understand his or her business objectives. As we go through the collaboration process, the ideas start to flow and that’s when the solutions start to take shape.I’m always interested in hearing from former colleagues, managers, or other IT folk, so feel free to contact me if you’d like to connect.
